title: Over 21 crore two-wheelers, 7 crore four-wheelers and above category of vehicles registered in India
description: ​​​In a written reply to the Lok Sabha, Nitin Gadkari said out of the total vehicles, 5,44,643 are electric two-wheelers while 54,252 are electric four-wheelers and above, as per the centralised data base -- VAHAN -- as on August 3, 2022. Data further revealed that there were 2,95,245 two-wheelers and 18,47,539 four-wheeler and above category of vehicles with fuel types of CNG, ethanol, fuel cell hydrogen, LNG, LPG, solar, methanol etc.
content: (You can now subscribe to our Economic Times WhatsApp channel)
